intro: Aerides odorata var. eburnea, commonly known as the fragrant orchid, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a pale pink or white hue. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This orchid thrives in humid, warm environments with bright, indirect light.
